result.execSummary:
The defendant Rufus G Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent

Costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rufus G Phillips

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter filed by Atty. Herbers.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:13 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rufus G Phillips in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Rufus G Phillips. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed today.  State recites the offer and notes they have complied with victim rights to proceed today.  Atty. Herbers confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Herbers.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
45 Days Jail Straight Time.

Term of Probation: 12 Months (Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County)

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

COSTS:  $243.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Atty. Herbers requesting to have the 8/11/2022 jury status removed from the calendar and matter set for plea and sentencing in mid-September.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
State's Witness List.

Returned Notice of Hearing addressed to Rufus G Philips for Jury Status Hearing on 01-11-22 at 8:30am
Return to Sender. Vacant. Unable to Forward.

Jury status hearing on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:00 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Rufus G Phillips did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Herbers provides an update, he is asking the matter be placed on the trial calendar, and believes the trial would take 2 days.  Court will adjourn for jury status hearing and jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
